CIRCULAR No. 02/2009 
 
Subject : Access control of Casual/Daily Labourers 
 
In supersession of this Bureau Circular No. 28/2002 dated 24-9-2008, the 
following directions are issued for deployment of casual/daily labourers of 
contractors, which shall be implemented by all concerned: 
 
(i) 
All airport/heliport operators shall issue, in place of tokens, web 
based bar-coded Photo Identity Card for casual/daily labourers; 
 
(ii) 
This system should have the provision of date and time of issue 
recorded on the pass and the hardware should store this data for a 
period of 30 days after the particular work is over. The software 
shall have provision for alerting the security control room for any 
overstay by any labourer. Also, the software shall have provision 
to detect and deny persons already black listed or who have come 
to adverse notice. 
 
(iii) 
RDCOS (CA), BCAS of the region will ensure implementation of 
the casual /daily labour web-based pass system at Delhi, Mumbai, 
Kolkata and Chennai airports; and CASO/In-charge of Airport 
Security Units at other airports. 
 
(iv) 
Airport Operators while awarding any contract for contractual 
work shall incorporate a clause “if contractor is found to violate 
any of security regulations, he shall be black listed and will be 
subjected to other legal Proceedings". 
 
(v) 
Entry of casual/daily labour should be staggered in such a way that 
minimum waiting time is taken for the labourers to enter their 
place of work.  
 
(vi) 
The contractor/supervisor shall furnish to the Airport Security Unit 
(APSU)/ASG a list of labourers requiring access to the airport

along with the prescribed format (Appendix-A). The APSU/ASG 
will get the signature/thumb impression of the labourers on the 
Register (Appendix-B) and mention the pass number. The list 
provided by contractor shall be kept in file serially and date wise. 
 
(vii) Each labourer shall carry the pass individually and the pass should 
not 
be collected by the contractor en-block. 
 
(viii) The format-A and the list of labourers furnished by the contractor, 
will be duly forwarded by airport operator/airline operators’ 
authorized signatories. The format will contain information about 
the name of work for which contractor has been authorized to 
engage labour. Specimen signature of authorized signatories shall 
be made available to ASG/APSU by the agencies concerned. 
 
(ix) 
The labourers shall be frisked thoroughly by APSU/ASG before 
entry into the airport. Labourers will enter and work in their 
allotted 
area 
under 
the 
supervision 
of 
their 
contractor/Sardar/Supervisor only. 
 
(x) 
This pass shall be taken back by the ASG/APSU from the 
labourers after the day's work is over, and deposited in safe 
custody of Airport Operator. 
 
(xi) 
On completion of work each day, the labourer will exit through the 
same gate through which he/she was allowed entry.  
 
(xii) The supervisor /officer In-charge of the gate will authenticate details 
of pass returned. Any discrepancy in the number of pass issued and 
returned should be reconciled on the spot. 
 
(xiii) Loss of pass shall be reported to airport operator and to concerned 
RDCOS (CA), BCAS by APSU/ASG; and also to the concerned 
Police Station. It should also be notified to all concerned to prevent 
misuse.  
 
(xiv) In case the labourers are required to remain in the operational area 
for 
continuity of work in the night, airport operator/airline operator 
will inform the APSU/ASG about this requirement and take 
clearance from APSU/ASG.

(xv) Officers of BCAS/ Airport Security Unit /ASG will carry out 
regular checks/for proper implementation of this Circular. 
 
(xvi) Under no circumstances, any private security guard or employee of 
any handling agency be issued casual/daily labour pass. 
 
(xvii) A cost of Rs. 30/- will be charged from the contractors towards 
issue of each web-based photo pass; 
 
 
(xviii) Penalty of Rs. 100/- may be charged for the loss of each pass and 
the amount to be paid to airport operator under proper receipt. 
 
(xix) These directions shall be implemented within a time frame of 90 
days from the date of issue without fail by all the airport operators. 
Violation of the above directions will attract appropriate action.
